summary:
• The Danish Prime Minister was attacked by a man in Copenhagen.
• A suspect has been arrested in connection with the incident.
• The attack occurred on the street in Copenhagen.

• France and its allies will finalize a plan to deploy military trainers to Ukraine.
• US President Joe Biden, other global leaders, and war veterans gather in France to commemorate the 80th anniversary of D-Day.

• The Irish polls have closed for both local and European Union elections.
• This marks the end of voting for these crucial elections.
• Results will be announced soon, determining the outcome of the contests.

• The United Nations has added Israel to its list of militaries committing violations against children.
• An Israeli official is poised to resign due to a failed post-war plan.
• Israel may launch an attack on Lebanon amid growing tensions with Hezbollah.

• Giorgia Meloni has taken a personal approach to campaigning for the European Parliament elections in Italy.
• The election will decide which party will hold the presidency of the European Commission, with significant implications for Italy's role in the EU.
• Meloni is emphasizing her leadership experience and commitment to promoting Italian interests within the EU.

• Kenyan President Uhuru Kenyatta has urged citizens to pay their taxes promptly and honestly.
• The government aims to use tax revenue to fund essential public services such as healthcare, education, and infrastructure development.
• By paying taxes, individuals contribute to the country's growth and prosperity.

• The European Union's election campaign has begun in the Netherlands, with an exit poll indicating a close race.
• A recent survey suggests that the outcome is too close to call at this stage.
• The result will have significant implications for the country's direction and policies moving forward.

• A couple got married in a Ukrainian bunker but the groom died two days later.
• Russia's attacks have caused widespread blackouts in Ukraine due to damage to power plants.
• The Gaza aid pier has been severely damaged by Russian airstrikes, resulting in estimated losses of at least $22 million.

• UK Prime Minister Rishi Sunak has apologized for leaving the D-Day commemorations early.
• Refugees on a remote UK island have spoken to the BBC about their experiences.
• Two British judges have left the Hong Kong court system due to political reasons.
• Former UK Prime Minister David Cameron fell victim to a prank phone call.
• TV personality Michael Mosley is currently missing while vacationing in Greece.

• Fatal black bear attack a first in California history
• Biden apologizes for delay in Ukraine military aid
• US jobs surge casts doubt over interest rate cuts

• The United Nations has confirmed that 11 of its personnel were detained by Houthi rebels in Yemen.
• The individuals involved work for the United Nations Assistance Mission to Yemen (UNHRC).
• The organization is working to secure their release and ensure their safety.
